article_title: Supreme Court Makes It Easier for Some to Sue Over Excessive Force
article_text:
WASHINGTON—A divided Supreme Court on Monday made it easier for criminal defendants to sue jail officers on allegations they used excessive force while holding an individual before trial.

The court, in a 5-4 opinion by Justice Stephen Breyer, ruled people in jail awaiting trial don’t have to prove officers subjectively believed they were using excessive force. Instead, a detainee “must show only that the force purposely or knowingly...
